Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure lion to right (head with added red on mane, part of eye with red pupil and mouth showing square teeth in added white and red tongue).
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 2395 in ABV, 13, no. 40 and Agora XXIII, pl. 68, no. 706. For the reverse curve setting off the mouth from the muzzle, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.137.16 in CVA Oxford 2, pl.1, no. 28 and ABV, 11, no. 9.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.20.5)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144 note 24)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (pl. 2, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0285) (Phase 1)
